purpleculture_pinyin:
xián
salted; salty; stingy; miserly
соленый; соленый; скупой; скупой
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 咸)
Antonyms: 淡
Pictophonetic: 咸 indicates the sound; 鹵 (salt) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
鹹菜 [ xián cài ]: salted vegetables; pickles
鹹魚 [ xián yú ]: salted fish
鹹淡 [ xián dàn ]: salty and unsalty (flavors); degree of saltiness; brackish (water)
鹹肉 [ xián ròu ]: bacon; salt-cured meat
鹹水湖 [ xián shuǐ hú ]: salt lake
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 鹵 [ lǔ ] salt
    • 咸 [ xián ] all, together, united; salted
heisig_chinese_memo: The one thing you know from seeing all those almost empty salt shakers in restaurants is that everybody likes to get salty sometimes.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The one thing you know from seeing all those almost empty salt shakers in restaurants is that everybody likes to get salty sometimes.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " halogen ", " salty " sound, the original meaning is the same taste like salt. "Shu‧Hong Fan": "The soil can be harvested, and it is moistened to make salty." "Shuwen": "Title. Northern taste. From halogen, salty sound." Duan Yucai's note: "Take the rhyme as a training. The taste of the north is also. The bitterness and bitterness can't give the taste of a certain party, and the one who writes here is wrong."

" Salty " can mean brine. "Compendium of Materia Medica‧Jinshi Department‧Luxian": "The salty sound is salty, the taste of moisturizing, the one with reduced sound, the name of salt. The later generations used the base as the flock, which is 矣."

" Xian " can also be used as a place name to indicate the land of defense during the Spring and Autumn Period. "The Thirteenth Year of the Spring and Autumn Period: Gong Hui Qihou, Song Gong, Chen Hou, Wei Hou, Zheng Bo, Xu Nan, Cao Bo Yu Xian "Yang Bojun's note: "Xian and Wei Di were sixty miles southeast of Puyang County, Henan Province." It also means Lu Di in the Spring and Autumn Period, "Chun Qiu‧ Wengong Eleventh Year": "Winter October Jiawu, Shusun Dechen defeated Di Yu Xian.” Yang Bojun’s note: “Xian, Lu Di, Shen Qinhan’s "Place Name Supplement" is said to be the Xianqiu in the "Jing" in the seventh year of Huan. It is in the south of Juye County, Shandong Province today, and the "Memorable Events" is said to be in Cao The county. In short, it is the same place as Xian in the 13th year."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " halogen ", " salty " sound, the original meaning is the same taste like salt.
humanum_full_description:
從「鹵」，「咸」聲，本義為像鹽一樣的味道。《書‧洪範》：「土爰稼穡，潤下作鹹。」《說文》：「銜也。北方味也。从鹵，咸聲。」段玉裁注：「以曡韵爲訓。北方味也。酸苦辛甘下不著某方之味，此著之者，錯見也。」

　　「鹹」可表示鹵水。《本草綱目‧金石部‧鹵鹹》：「鹹音咸，潤下之味，音減者，鹽生之名。後人作鹼作鹻，是矣。」

　　「鹹」還可用作地名，表示春秋時的衛地，《春秋‧僖公十三年》：「公會齊侯、宋公、陳侯、衛侯、鄭伯、許男、曹伯于鹹。」楊伯峻注：「鹹、衛地，在今河南省濮陽縣東南六十里。」也表示春秋時的魯地，《春秋‧文公十一年》：「冬十月甲午，叔孫得臣敗狄于鹹。」楊伯峻注：「鹹，魯地，沈欽韓《地名補注》謂即桓七年《經》之咸丘，在今山東省巨野縣南，《大事表》則謂在今曹縣境。總之，與僖十三年之鹹為兩地。」
humanum_short_description: 從「鹵」，「咸」聲，本義為像鹽一樣的味道。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
鹹 (Simplified: 咸)
Pinyin: xián
English Definition: salted; salty; stingy; miserly
Antonyms: 淡
Total strokes: 20; Radical: 鹵
Pictophonetic: 咸 indicates the sound; 鹵 (salt) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 鹵 [ lǔ ] salt
    • 咸 [ xián ] all, together, united; salted
Example Words:
鹹菜 [ xián cài ]: salted vegetables; pickles
鹹魚 [ xián yú ]: salted fish
鹹淡 [ xián dàn ]: salty and unsalty (flavors); degree of saltiness; brackish (water)
鹹肉 [ xián ròu ]: bacon; salt-cured meat
鹹水湖 [ xián shuǐ hú ]: salt lake
More: 鹹* | *鹹 | *鹹*

Liushutong characters (3)

鹹字的基本解释

鹹
xián
同“咸”②。

鹹字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xián］
［《廣韻》胡讒切，平咸，匣。］
(1)像盐那样的味道。
(2)地名。春秋卫地。故地在今河南省濮阳县东南。
(3)地名。春秋鲁地。
[②]［jiǎn］
亦作“醶2”。
盐土。

鹹字的康熙字典解释

【亥集下】【鹵字部】　鹹； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1507第20
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】胡讒切【正韻】胡嵒切，?音咸。【說文】鹹，銜也。北方味也。【廣韻】不淡。【韻會】鹽味。【爾雅·釋言】鹹，苦也。【疏】?殊極必苦，故以鹹爲苦也。【書·洪範】潤下作鹹。【周禮·天官·醫師】以鹹養脈。　又地名。【春秋·僖十三年】會于鹹。【註】衞地，東郡濮陽縣東南有鹹城。　又【韻會】古斬切，音減。【本草】李時珍曰：鹹音咸者，潤下之味，音減者，鹽生之名。後人作鹼作鹻，是矣。

鹹字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鹹字的起名意思

暂无。

salty
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xián］
["Guangyun" Hu slander cut, plain and salty, box. ]
(1) Taste like salt.
(2) Place name. Spring and Autumn Guards. The hometown was in the southeast of Puyang County, Henan Province.
(3) Place name. Spring and Autumn Lu land.
[②]［jiǎn］
Also known as "醶2".
saline.
salty
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Haiji 2】【halogen word department】　Xian; Kangxi strokes: 20; page number: page 1507 No. 20
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Hu Yanqie [Zheng Yun] Hu Yanqie, sound is salty. [Said Wen] Xian, title is also. The taste of the north is also. [Guang Yun] Not light. 【Rhyme】Salt flavor. 【Erya·Interpretation】Salt and bitter. 【Sparse】? The extreme must be bitter, so salty is also bitter. 【Book·Hong Fan】Run down and make salty. 【Zhou Li·Tian Guan·Physician】Nourishing the pulse with salt.　Also place name. [Spring and Autumn·Xi Thirteen Years] Hui Yu Xian. [Note] Weidi, there is Xiancheng in the southeast of Puyang County, East County.　[Yunhui] Gu cut and cut, sound reduced. [Materia Medica] Li Shizhen said: the name of salty sound, the taste of moisturizing, the name of reducing sound, the name of salt. Later generations used the base as the flycatcher.
